stories.text:
I've been applying to jobs, so I've been encountering more hcaptchas than I would like -- more than zero.

It's humiliating -- even moreso than applying to jobs already is -- and I don't like working for free, and it's just a pain in the ass.

Can I attach some type of banana bag blood drip to my computer and maybe automatically shoot that live blood analysis info over to the various job description saas hosting providers in realtime so I don't have to tag the fucking boats and bikes anymore?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do I prove that I'm a human, once and for all? (captcha)
Can Bias Be Eliminated from Algorithms?
Colour-changing magnifying glass gives clear view of infrared light
Rio Tinto lithium mine: thousands of protesters block roads across Serbia
Hydrothermal Venture: Day 5: Advent of Code â€“ Python Solution
If macOS is Unix, and Linux was inspired Unix, then what is Windows based on?

stories.text:
I have an idea, but after much thought I realized, it's not a problem that (my target) people face every day or every week, maybe not even every year.

It's a problem people face every time they start a project, my idea is basically a decision helper, and those decisions are just made every time they start a project.

I have no prior experience in building and running services (SaaS), so I would like your opinions on this matter.

And also, I can't find other SaaS that solves passive problems like mine, so I can't decide if this would be a good idea. So if you know any such service, please let me know.

Thanks.
stories.title: Ask HN: Shuold I continue to build a product for a passive problem?
